revised_title: Alan Nigel Drury: A Pioneering Life in Science and Medicine
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Alan Nigel Drury, a notable figure in science and medicine. Born in London, Drury pursued a career in medicine and made significant contributions to the fields of physiology, pathology, and cardiology. His experiences during World War I and his time at Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge, shaped his approach to learning and his research. Drury's work in experimental pathology and cardiology had a direct impact on health and disease, and his administrative abilities were showcased during his time in India.
